intro: Hymenolobus procumbens var. catalonicus, commonly known as the Catalonian bladder nut, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features small, green, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
